meanings.definition: Able to be compared in order to show differences.
meanings.sent1: The two paintings were very contrastable in terms of color and style.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a contrastable example to explain the concept to the students.
meanings.sent3: It was quite contrastable how the two siblings had such different personalities.
meanings.sent4: The contrastable opinions of the group led to a lively discussion.
meanings.sent5: The contrastable patterns on the fabric made it stand out.

meanings.definition: Capable of being distinguished by differences in qualities.
meanings.sent1: The two breeds of dogs were easily contrastable based on their size and fur.
meanings.sent2: The contrastable flavors of the dish made it a unique culinary experience.
meanings.sent3: It was contrastable how the two cars had different features despite looking similar.
meanings.sent4: The contrastable personalities of the twins made them easy to tell apart.
meanings.sent5: The contrastable scents of the flowers filled the garden with fragrance.
